alert.note: Alert for Northeast Mountains (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 13 at 12:32PM PDT by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Stevens County through 100 PM PDT... At 1232 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Addy, or 41 miles west of Priest River, moving northeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Addy. This includes U.S. Highway 395 in Washington between mile markers 210 and 218. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
